definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: In particular this means that this file is not malicious but a false alarm .
sentences.chinese: 这意味着，这个文件是没有恶意的，只是虚惊一场。

sentences.english: Wanting to do him dirt, she sent his wife a poison-pen letter.
sentences.chinese: 施诡计就写了一封恶意中伤的信给他的妻子。

sentences.english: The North views Southern pamphleteering as hostile propaganda.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜认为韩国的传单为恶意宣传。

sentences.english: The third chapter is about the malicious actions of tort factor in theory.
sentences.chinese: 第三章是关于恶意诉讼侵权行为构成要件的理论探讨。

sentences.english: There was no harm in it though he did say son.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他确实是说儿子，但这话倒不含有什么恶意。

sentences.english: Walter's spiteful remarks were quite uncalled for.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔特恶意的话完全是多余的。

sentences.english: It was necessary to forbid malicious criticism of the peasant associations.
sentences.chinese: 必须不准人恶意地批评农会。

sentences.english: Slander , the viper , has wrongfully accused me.
sentences.chinese: 谣言这条毒蛇对我进行了恶意中伤。

sentences.english: A bit long perhaps but otherwise nonoffensive and kind of sweet.
sentences.chinese: 虽然可能有点长，但却毫无恶意，反而有种温馨感。

sentences.english: I gave my ear to what I now know was the malice of slander .
sentences.chinese: 我过去听信了谣言，现在我知道那是恶意中伤。

sentences.english: You’ve got such promise, yet you’re  squandering it on  malice.
sentences.chinese: 你很有前途，可是你却将之浪费在恶意揣测上。

sentences.english: He didn't owe her ill will.
Lots of spiteful sharks and other venomous beasts breed all over the basin.
sentences.chinese: 大量的恶意鲨鱼和其他有毒的动物品种全流域。

sentences.english: These nouns refer to the feeling or expression of deep-seated ill will.
sentences.chinese: 这些名词指根深蒂固的恶意的感情或表述。

sentences.english: This is a slanderous misrepresentation of our policy.
sentences.chinese: 这是对我们的政策的恶意歪曲。

sentences.english: Xu Tings dishonest act of drawing money from ATM belongs to larceny in the scope of the criminal law.
sentences.chinese: 许霆恶意取款行为应属于刑法调整范围，构成盗窃罪。

definition: to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
